briefdescription.para: Calculates the absolute value of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the absolute value of the input number. If the number is negative, it will return the positive equivalent, and if the number is positive, it will return the same value.

simplesect.para: The absolute value of the number

briefdescription.para: Computes the sine of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the sine of the given input (in radians) and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard sine function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the sine operation.

briefdescription.para: Computes the cosine of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the cosine of the given input (in radians) and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard cosine function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the cosine operation.

briefdescription.para: Converts a value to a real (double) value.

detaileddescription.para: This function converts the input to a real (double) value and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It handles type conversion from integer or string to double.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the conversion.

briefdescription.para: Computes the tangent of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the tangent of the given input (in radians) and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard tangent function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the tangent operation.

briefdescription.para: Computes the power of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the result of raising the first parameter to the power of the second parameter, and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard power function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the power operation.

briefdescription.para: Computes the square root of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the square root of the given input and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard square root function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the square root operation.

briefdescription.para: Computes the arctangent of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the arctangent (inverse tangent) of the given input (in radians) and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard arctangent function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the arctangent operation.

briefdescription.para: Computes the arctangent of two numbers.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the arctangent of two numbers (y/x) and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard two-argument arctangent function in the math library, useful for handling all quadrants of a coordinate system.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the arctangent operation.

briefdescription.para: Computes the ceiling of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the smallest integer greater than or equal to the given input and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard ceiling function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the ceiling operation.

briefdescription.para: Rounds a number to the nearest integer.

detaileddescription.para: This function rounds the given input to the nearest integer and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard round function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the rounding operation.

briefdescription.para: Computes the remainder of a division.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the remainder when dividing the first number by the second, and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard floating-point modulus function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the modulus operation.

briefdescription.para: Generates a random number.

detaileddescription.para: This function generates a random number between 0 and 32767 (inclusive). It can be used to introduce randomness into the program.

briefdescription.para: Returns the ASCII value of the first character of a string.

detaileddescription.para: This function takes a string and returns the ASCII value of its first character. If the string is empty, it returns 0.

simplesect.para: The ASCII value of the first character of the string

briefdescription.para: Converts a string to its numerical value.

detaileddescription.para: This function converts the provided string representation of a number to its numerical equivalent (either integer or floating point).

simplesect.para: The numerical value of the string

briefdescription.para: Converts a hexadecimal string to its integer value.

detaileddescription.para: This function converts the provided hexadecimal string to its integer equivalent. The string should represent a valid hexadecimal number, optionally prefixed with "&".

simplesect.para: The integer equivalent of the hexadecimal string

briefdescription.para: Converts an octal string to its integer value.

detaileddescription.para: This function converts the provided octal string to its integer equivalent. The string should represent a valid octal number.

simplesect.para: The integer equivalent of the octal string

briefdescription.para: Converts a string to an integer.

detaileddescription.para: This function converts the provided string representation of a number to its integer equivalent. It will ignore any leading spaces and handle the conversion from decimal format.

simplesect.para: The integer equivalent of the string

briefdescription.para: Shifts a number left by a specified number of bits.

detaileddescription.para: This function performs a bitwise left shift operation on an integer by the number of bits specified by the second operand. It is equivalent to multiplying the number by 2 for each bit position shifted.

simplesect.para: The result of the left shift operation

briefdescription.para: Shifts a number right by a specified number of bits.

detaileddescription.para: This function performs a bitwise right shift operation on an integer by the number of bits specified by the second operand. It is equivalent to dividing the number by 2 for each bit position shifted.

simplesect.para: The result of the right shift operation

briefdescription.para: Computes the arcsine of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the arcsine (inverse sine) of the given input (in radians) and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard arcsine function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the arcsine operation.

briefdescription.para: Computes the arccosine of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the arccosine (inverse cosine) of the given input (in radians) and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard arccosine function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the arccosine operation.

briefdescription.para: Computes the exponential of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the exponential of the given input, which is the constant e raised to the power of the input, and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard exponential function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the exponential operation.

briefdescription.para: Computes the natural logarithm of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the natural logarithm (base e) of the given input and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a wrapper around the standard logarithm function in the math library.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the logarithmic operation.

briefdescription.para: Converts a number from radians to degrees.

detaileddescription.para: This function converts the given input (in radians) to degrees and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a simple calculation using the formula degrees = radians * (180 / ).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the conversion.

briefdescription.para: Converts a number from degrees to radians.

detaileddescription.para: This function converts the given input (in degrees) to radians and stores the result in the provided res pointer. It is a simple calculation using the formula radians = degrees * ( / 180).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the result of the conversion.

briefdescription.para: Returns the sign of a number.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns 1 if the number is positive, -1 if it is negative, and 0 if it is zero. It can be used to determine whether a number is positive, negative, or zero.

simplesect.para: The sign of the number (1, -1, or 0)

briefdescription.para: Rounds a number to the nearest integer.

detaileddescription.para: This function rounds the provided number to the nearest integer. If the number is halfway between two integers, it rounds up to the next higher integer.

briefdescription.para: BASIC maths functions.
